summary: This document details a new lawsuit filed against Jeffrey Epstein by an individual identified as Jane Doe II, alleging sexual battery. The filing includes information about the case parties, attorney representation, and various docket entries related to the case. This document contains multiple complaints filed against Jeffrey Epstein by various plaintiffs identified as Jane Doe No. 1, Jane Doe No. 2, and Jane Doe No. 3. Each complaint details allegations of sexual assault and emotional distress, highlighting Epstein's pattern of recruiting underage girls for sexual acts under the guise of providing massages. The complaints seek compensatory and punitive damages for the plaintiffs and their families.

persons.name: Jane Doe No. 1
persons.context: Jane Doe No. 1 alleges that she was sexually assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein when she was 14 years old.

persons.context: She is also a plaintiff in the case, bringing claims individually.

persons.name: Jane Doe No. 2
persons.context: Jane Doe No. 2 alleges that she was sexually assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein when she was approximately 16 years old.

persons.name: Jane Doe No. 3
persons.context: Jane Doe No. 3 brings a complaint against Epstein for sexual assault that occurred when she was a minor.

keyFacts: Jane Doe II filed a lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein on July 10, 2008, alleging sexual battery.
Isidro Manuel Garcia is the attorney representing Jane Doe II in the lawsuit.
Diana Lewis is the judge assigned to the case.
The lawsuit is pending in the Circuit Civil Court in Palm Beach County.
The document includes various docket entries related to the case.
Jane Doe No. 1, Jane Doe No. 2, and Jane Doe No. 3 are all plaintiffs alleging sexual assault by Jeffrey Epstein.
The complaints detail a pattern of Epstein recruiting underage girls for sexual acts under the pretense of providing massages.
Each plaintiff seeks damages in excess of $50 million.
The document highlights Epstein's wealth and influence as a factor in his ability to carry out his alleged crimes.
The complaints are filed under fictitious names to protect the identities of the minor victims.
